snippet: Old-time prosecco producers have created a special designation to protect their terroir.
abstract: Old-time prosecco producers in Italy have created a special designation to protect their terroir; while most prosecco is nonvintage, enabling producers to blend wine from the previous year, more and more superiore wineries are making a millesimato, in which all the grapes must be from one vintage.
lead_paragraph: Old-time prosecco producers have created a special designation to protect their terroir.

headline.seo: Long-Time Prosecco Vineyards Act to Protect Their Designation
headline.main: Prosecco Growers Act to Guard Its Pedigree
headline.print_headline: Prosecco Growers Act to Guard Its Pedigree
